channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI is phasing out Scale AI work following startup’s Meta deal
item.description: OpenAI’s plans inject new uncertainty into Scale’s business in the wake of Meta’s unusual deal.

item.title: Hurricane Erick Makes Landfall in Mexico as a Major Storm
item.description: The hurricane had been a Category 4 storm as it bore down from the eastern Pacific toward Mexico. The authorities ordered evacuations in Oaxaca and Gu...

item.title: Past the event horizon? OpenAI’s Sam Altman says so. New AI research backs him up
item.description: Researchers from Sakana AI and Google DeepMind have created AI that can improve its own code.

item.title: Israeli defense minister says Iran’s supreme leader ‘should not continue to exist’ after Iranian missiles wound 240
item.description: Israel carried out strikes on Iran’s Arak heavy water reactor.

item.title: Luxury’s $1.7 trillion headache: The sector lost 50 million customers last year and is struggling with selfie-happy Gen Z
item.description: Bain & Co's latest luxury sector report found growth slowed particularly in the personal goods sector last year—the first time in 15 years with the ex...

item.title: How Black Lung Came Roaring Back to Coal Country
item.description: Once nearly eradicated, the “old man’s disease” is back and suffocating younger miners. Federal cuts risk putting a solution further out of reach.

item.title: Fed’s Interest-Rate Approach Keeps It on Collision Course With Trump
item.description: The central bank signals little urgency to cut interest rates despite demands from President Trump for lower borrowing costs.

item.title: Tariffs, war, and inequality have battered the luxury goods market—Gucci sales are down 24%
item.description: Global sales of personal luxury goods are ”slowing down but not collapsing,” according to a Bain & Co. consultancy study.

item.title: TikTok Hits Cannes, Where a U.S. Ban Seems a Distant Dream
item.description: TikTok executives hosted happy hours and played pickleball with influencers on the French Riviera this week, even as a U.S. ban loomed over the compan...

item.title: Marijuana’s Links to Heart Attack and Stroke Are Becoming Clearer
item.description: The evidence is stacking up that the drug is associated with a greater likelihood of heart problems.

item.title: No Rock Stars, No Mercedes: A Russian Expo Shows the Cost of Divorce With the West
item.description: The annual economic forum in St. Petersburg used to yield multibillion-dollar deals and feature performances by global music stars. With the war in Uk...

item.title: Europe to Hold Talks With Iran on Friday
item.description: The continent’s most important leaders are divided over Israel’s conduct and filled with fears about a spiraling regional conflict.

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Will Decide on Iran Attack ‘in the Next Two Weeks,’ White House Says
item.description: European officials, who have been effectively sidelined in the war between Israel and Iran, will try to exert limited leverage in a meeting with Irani...

item.title: Chilling Photos Capture Police Shooting Man, Fueling Anger in Kenya
item.description: The protests and police shooting on Tuesday came nearly a year after demonstrations against President William Ruto of Kenya convulsed the country.

item.title: As talk grows of regime change in Iran, here’s a look at the 1953 coup that helped reshape the Middle East.
